tier_1_determinative.ipc_sections_charged: Prevention of Corruption Act, Sections 7, 12, 13(1)(d) read with 13(2)

tier_2_material.motive_for_crime: Demand for bribe to release an individual from police custody

tier_3_contextual.place_of_offense: Vashi Railway Police Station, complainant's house

tier_4_procedural.case_number: Criminal Appeal No. 472 of 2007, Criminal Appeal No. 460 of 2007
tier_4_procedural.case_title: Arjun Baban Jagdhane vs. The State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.appellant_or_petitioner: Arjun Baban Jagdhane, Jagannath Shivram Jadhav
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_appellant: Mr. Ujwal Agandsurve (Appeal No. 460 of 2007), Mr. P. R. Arjunwadkar (Criminal Appeal No. 472 of 2007)
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: Prevention of Corruption Act, Sections 7, 12, 13(1)(d) read with 13(2)
tier_4_procedural.acts_and_sections: Prevention of Corruption Act, Sections 7, 12, 13(1)(d) read with 13(2)

residual_details.additional_facts: The appellants were convicted by the Special Judge under the Prevention of Corruption Act. Accused No.1 (Arjun Baban Jagdhane) was a Police Inspector and accused No.2 (Jagannath Shivram Jadhav) was allegedly involved in the acceptance of a bribe. The complainant, Ruksana Banu, alleged that accused No.1 demanded a bribe to release her brother-in-law, Mohd. Nabi Qureshi, from custody. The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) was involved, and a trap was set up leading to the arrest of the accused. The defense argued that the accused were falsely implicated and questioned the competency of the sanctioning authority.
